did.physdesc: Articles, reprints, pamphlets, correspondence, news clippings.

defitem.label: Contact Information:
defitem.item: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives Martin P. Catherwood Library 227 Ives Hall Cornell University Ithaca, NY 14853 (607) 255-3183> kheel_center@cornell.edu http://www.ilr.cornell.edu/library/kheel

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of a 3-ring binder regarding the 1992 campaign to decertify the union at International Paper's Androscoggin Mill in Jay, Maine. The materials have been removed from the binder and placed in acid-free folders. One folder was used for each section of the binder, thus maintaining the original order. The first section consists of loose notes and papers found in the front of the binder. The second section contains copies of the Androscoggin Mill company newsletter about the campaign. This is followed by photocopies of newspaper articles, mostly from local papers. Also included are photocopies of leaflets and broadsides put out by both the International Paper Company and the United Paperworkers International Union, and newspaper clippings.
A business card from Mr. Bradley L. Peters, Manager of Communications for the Androscoggin Mill, was inserted in the front of the binder. It is likely that Mr. Peters assembled the notebook.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Androscoggin Mill Decertification Campaign Notebook #6368. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Androscoggin Mill decertification newsletter issues no.1-18 and Final Issue.
